title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in most places on the island during the afternoon or night.

title: Tsunami warning canceled for Papua New Guinea after strong magnitude 6.9 earthquake
byline: A tsunami warning was canceled for Papua New Guinea after a strong magnitude 6.9 earthquake, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.

title: Large narcotics haul seized off Western Coast
byline: A large consignment of narcotics was seized by the Sri Lanka Navy during a joint operation with the Narcotics Bureau in the seas off the western coast of the island, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Grand ceremonial reception for Indian PM Narendra Modi commences
byline: The official welcoming ceremony for the Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi, who arrived in Sri Lanka last night (April 4) for a three-day state visit, is currently underway at Independence Square in Colombo.

title: Updated traffic plan issued for today due to Indian PM Modi’s visit
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have issued an updated statement regarding road closures in and around Colombo today (April 5), in line with the special traffic plan implemented for the ongoing state visit of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Court order issued against planned protest by FSP and IUSF
byline: Sri Lanka Police have obtained a court order from the Fort Magistrate’s Court against the planned protest by the Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) and the Inter-University Students’ Federation (IUSF) today.

title: President Dissanayake and Indian PM Modi hold high-level bilateral talks
byline: The high-level Indo-Lanka bilateral discussions, with the participation of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Anura Kumara Dissanayake along with their respective delegations, were held at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo, a short while ago.

title: PM Modi and President AKD virtually launch multiple Indo-Lanka projects
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today virtually witnessed the commencement of several key Indo-Lanka joint projects.

title: PM Modi’s visit: India and Sri Lanka sign several MoUs
byline: Several Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) were exchanged between India and Sri Lanka in the areas of power, energy, health, economics, IT, digital transformation, and defense cooperation, during Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ongoing visit.

title: Sri Lanka honours Indian PM Modi with ‘Mithra Vibhushana’ Award
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was presented with the highest award given to a foreign national, the ‘Mithra Vibhushana’ award, by Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake during a ceremony held at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo today (05).

title: Modi and Dissanayake discuss maritime, regional security and fishermen issue
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the Sampur Solar Power Plant, Multi-product Pipeline, and Trincomalee Energy Hub will benefit all Sri Lankans, and that the interconnectivity agreement will enable Sri Lanka to export electricity.

title: Sri Lanka sends military team to assist Myanmar’s earthquake victims
byline: A team of Sri Lankan tri-forces personnel, including medical staff, departed for Myanmar on a special flight on Saturday to provide relief assistance to earthquake victims, the Defence Ministry said.

title: Over 700kg of heroin and ‘Ice’ seized in seas off western coast
byline: A large consignment of narcotics, consisting of over 700 kilograms of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (ICE), was seized during an operation in the seas off the western coast today (05), according to the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: India, Sri Lanka sign landmark defence pact during Modi’s visit
byline: In a significant step towards bolstering bilateral ties, India and Sri Lanka on Saturday signed a landmark defence cooperation agreement following high-level talks between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Modi meets Sajith in Colombo
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has met with Sri Lanka’s Leader of the Opposition and Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) leader Sajith Premadasa in Colombo, during his official state visit to the island.

title: Modi meets delegation of Tamil leaders in Sri Lanka
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met a delegation of Tamil political party representatives in Colombo, during his ongoing visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Modi says multi-product pipeline, Trinco energy hub will benefit Sri Lanka
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday that the agreement reached to build a multi-product pipeline and to develop Trincomalee as an energy hub will benefit the people of Sri Lanka.

title: BASL voices concern over death of youth in Welikada police custody
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has expressed grave concern over the death of a youth while in the custody of the Welikada Police in the early hours of April 02, 2025.

title: PM Narendra Modi meets Sri Lanka’s 1996 World Cup heroes in Colombo
byline: During his official visit to Colombo, the Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi, had the opportunity to engage with members of the iconic 1996 Sri Lankan cricket team, which secured the nation’s historic victory in the ICC Cricket World Cup that year.
